comments: Horrible teacher! He will rarely answer any questions and if he does, he makes you feel like a complete idiot. Throws everything at you and expects you to figure it out on your own, horrible teaching methods. TA\'s were cool and helpful.

Swears and yells at students. Intentionally tries to fail students. Dave expects that we know everything he knows and that we can read his mind; he treats us like we have been engineers for 20+ years, when it\'s our first engineering experience. Bad first impression if you ask me. And this is suppose to be an intro class... Worst "teacher" EVER.
Bad teacher. Strict grading. Expects students to figure everything out themselves. His TAs are alright and the guy teaching actual machining is a good teacher.

From the one and only detailed lecture he gave(which was about himself)he was good at what he was doing.That is great but this is a University and the people who are hired should be hired for their teaching abilities.Students pay money to the university to be TAUGHT.I am bewildered and baffled by this guys sheer incompetence as a teacher.

First year in UMD and paid so much for this school,but what i get is non-care and never teach anything useful.he expects us to figure out everything by ourselves (as we are an engineering).hey,i think the best way to get easy money is to be like him.never teach in class,only small little thing though,and then get paid from STUDENT\'S PARENT\'S MONEY.
Class was hard. Teaching method cannot be accepted by most of the classmates.

I pretty nice guy, but not a great teacher. Biggest problem is that he is very vague about expectations on assignments. It\'s hard to know what he wants unless you ask the right questions. Definitely seems to have favorites, so if you get on his good side you\'ll be alright.
